references.paper_title: Reconstructing the mind's eye: fmri-to-image with contrastive learning and diffusion priors
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it introduces a novel method for fMRI-to-image reconstruction using contrastive learning and diffusion priors, which are also central to this paper's approach.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces the latent diffusion model, which is a key component of the proposed fMRI-to-video reconstruction framework.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, which is used to align fMRI data with video data and is a key component of the proposed framework.

references.paper_title: Reconstructing visual experiences from brain activity evoked by natural movies
references.reason: This is a seminal paper in the field of fMRI-to-video reconstruction, which laid the foundation for many subsequent studies.

references.paper_title: Neural encoding and decoding with deep learning for dynamic natural vision
references.reason: This paper introduces the cc2017 dataset used in the experiments, which is a key resource for evaluating the proposed method.
